P008911.project_name: Agriculture Credit and Agro Industry Project

keywords.cdata: accounting,accounting principles,accruals,agricultural development,agricultural extension,agricultural growth,agricultural marketing,agricultural production,Agriculture,arable land,Bad debt,Bad debt provisions,balance of payments,Bank loans,Bank rediscounts,Bank supervision,banking system,barley,beef,Cattle,Central Bank,cereals,commodities,consumer interests,Cooperatives,cotton,crop yields,crops,debt,deposits,development strategy,drylands,Economic Rate of Return,eggs,employment,Environmental Impact,equilibrium,equipment,exports,Extension,farmers,farming,farming systems,farms,feed,fertilizers,financial planning,financial structure,FISCAL YEAR,Fish,fisheries,food processing,food production,foreign exchange,fruits,GNP,goats,growth rate,income,income distribution,incomes,inheritance,interest rate,interest rates,Irrigation,irrigation systems,land reform,Land Use,laws,legal provision,legislation,legumes,liquidity,livestock,Livestock Development,m2,marketing,maturities,oil,pastures,policy instruments,population growth,portfolio,precipitation,price increases,Private sector,productive assets,productivity,profitability,project loans,reserve requirement,Rural Development,rural employment,rural income,rural poverty,savings,sheep,technical assistance,transport,value added,vegetables,water use,wheat,working capital

project_abstract.cdata: The project would help finance part of TCZB's agricultural investment program over three years by means of provision of credit for: (a) supervised loans to farmers for investment and production costs in crops and livestock; (b) expansion of investment in certain categories of agroindustries; (c) purchase of one ferryboat for fruit and vegetable truck transport to trans-Mediterranean markets; and (d) purchase of vehicles for TCZB field staff. It would also help strengthen the operations, financial practices and technical capabilities of TCZB through consultants and experts for technical assistance and training.
